description: This slice is great warm from the oven, but also great cold for a picnic or the school/work lunch box.
name: Zucchini Sweet Potato and Spinach Slice Recipe | Woolworths
recipeIngredient: 150g baby spinach (or finely chopped silver beet)
2 small zucchini, grated, excess moisture removed
2 cups grated cheese (i use half tasty half parmesan)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 180C. Grease and line 2, 20 x 20 lamington square trays with non stick foil.

Heat the oil in a large non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Cook the onion or leek stirring, for 3 minutes or until soft. Add in the garlic, parsley and chives and stir for 1-2 minutes or until soft.
If needed add another drop of oil, add zucchini, sweet potato, carrot and cook for 2 minutes. Turn the heat off and add baby spinach or silverbeet and let it wilt with the heat of the pan.
Whisk the eggs, egg whites and flour in a large bowl until smooth. Add cream. Stir the zucchini mixture, into the egg mixture and season.
Pour the mixture into the prepared pans and add the crumbled feta in.
Cover with your choice of grated cheese.
Bake for 40-50 minutes or until golden and cooked through. Set aside to cool slightly, remove from tray and serve warm or cold.
